thread.title: 108 Nebraska students named National Merit semifinalists
thread.title_full: 108 Nebraska students named National Merit semifinalists

author: Luna Stephens World-Herald Staff Writer
title: 108 Nebraska students named National Merit semifinalists
text:
The National Merit Scholarship Corporation has named 108 Nebraska high school students as semifinalists for the organization's 2026 scholarship program.
Semifinalists were chosen based on their performance on the 2024 Preliminary SAT test, which serves as the qualifying exam for the program.
The organization named 6,000 semifinalists nationwide out of the more than 1.3 million students who took the exam, according to a press release from the organization.
The students who score the highest on the exam in each state are chosen as semifinalists, and the number of semifinalists in a state is proportional to the state's percentage of the national total of graduating seniors, according to the release.
To become a finalist, semifinalists must submit a detailed scholarship application, have an outstanding academic record throughout high school, be endorsed and recommended by a high school official, write an essay and earn an SAT or ACT score that "confirms their earlier performance on the qualifying test," according to the organization.
Finalists for the scholarships will be announced in February. Those finalists will be considered for approximately 6,930 scholarships totalling nearly $26 million.
The organization expects about 95% of semifinalists to attain finalist standing, and about half of the finalists to win a National Merit scholarship.
Scholarship winners will be announced beginning in April.
Here are the semifinalists from Nebraska:

Auburn High School
